result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian D. Kraus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian D. Kraus in court with attorney William R. F. Ackell. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF-189 and 15CF-348.

10:29 AM Court calls cases.
Court addressess rights and understandings for this section of the day for Defendants scheduled for 10:30 am.

10:35 AM Atty Molepske states appearances.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court, there is a plea agreement in this case.
There had been a prior NGI plea undertaken by Atty McFarland.  This will be withdrawn and will be entering a plea today.

15CF-189: Defendant will plead to Count 1. State recommends 13 yrs prison - 4 yrs initial and 9 yrs extended. Defense is free to argue and parties will be requesting a PSI.

State moves 15CF-348 dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes.

Atty Ackell concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court informs Defendant of charge and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST for Count 1 in 15CF-189.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Ackell for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Court takes a moment to re-review the complaint.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-189: Count 1: Arson of Building
15CF-348: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.
PSI to be completed and provided to the parties at least one week prior to sentencing.

Court will allow parties to double check to make sure sentencing hrg date will work.

Court questions Defense regarding withdrawal of NGI plea.

BY THE COURT:
Court accepts the withdrawal.
Plea hearing on October 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.
original filed in 15CF189
Plea hearing on October 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
original filed in 16CF189
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Response to State's Discovery Demand

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 11-23-2015 09:00 am

9:57 a.m. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty McFarland states there is a conflict with respresenting the Defendant.  Atty McFarland states in case 15CF189 that the Defendant will be changing his plea of Not Guilty to NGI.  BTC: NGI is entered. NGI examination by 11-02-15. Motion to Withdrawal of Atty McFarland is granted and public defender office has assigned Atty Wallace to the case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 10-26-2015 09:30 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Brian D. Kraus in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Brian D. Kraus in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 10-12-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Brian D. Kraus appeared in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian D. Kraus appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Erik John Mcfarland in court for Defendant Brian D. Kraus.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC: Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-05-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Brian D. Kraus appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Atty COusins indicates this matter was rescheduled to today's date to allow for the defendant to appear with his attorney Erik McFarland who is not present.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
